xxl.core.cursors.identities
Class TeeCursor.FileStorageArea<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.identities.TeeCursor.FileStorageArea<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements this storage area is able to store.
All Implemented Interfaces:
TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>
Enclosing class:
TeeCursor<E>
public static class TeeCursor.FileStorageArea<E>
extends Object
implements TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>

A TeeCursor.StorageArea that stores elemenst in a file.

Field Summary
protected  BufferedRandomAccessFile braf
          The BufferedRandomAccessFile used to store the objects in this StorageArea.
protected  Converter<E> converter
          A suitable converter for the objects to store.
protected  File file
          The File used for braf;
 
Constructor Summary

          Creates a new FileStorageArea.
 
Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes and deletes the file to release resources.
 Cursor<E> cursor()
          Returns a cursor that delivers the file's elements from its beginning.
 void insert(E o)
          Stored the object o in the file.
 boolean isSingleton()
          As reading from the file is not destroying, it can be traversed by more than one iterator and this StorageArea is not singleton.

Constructor Detail

TeeCursor.FileStorageArea

public TeeCursor.FileStorageArea(File file,
                                 Converter<E> converter,
                                 Buffer<?,?,? super E> buffer,
                                 int blockSize)
Creates a new FileStorageArea.

Parameters:
file - an instance of the class File representing the storage area that will be used in the method cursor() to deliver a further output-iteration of this operator.
converter - the converter used to serialize the input iterations elements.
buffer - the buffer that is used for buffering the file.
blockSize - the size of a block of buffered bytes.
Method Detail

insert

public void insert(E o)
Stored the object o in the file.

Specified by:
insert in interface TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>
Parameters:
o - the element to insert

cursor

public Cursor<E> cursor()
Returns a cursor that delivers the file's elements from its beginning. As this does not delete them from the file, this StorageArea is not singleton.

Specified by:
cursor in interface TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>
Returns:
a cursor delivering the file's elements

isSingleton

public boolean isSingleton()
As reading from the file is not destroying, it can be traversed by more than one iterator and this StorageArea is not singleton.

Specified by:
isSingleton in interface TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>
Returns:
false

close

public void close()
Closes and deletes the file to release resources.

Specified by:
close in interface TeeCursor.StorageArea<E>
